page.title: 08MUNDON - BUILDINGS
page.content: There are not many buildings in our area because all of it is farmland, wasteland and water. On Iltney Farm there is a farmhouse some of which is about 500 years old; a modern bungalow and some modern farm buildings. The farmsheds used to be timber Essex barns but they were in a bad state of repair and not ideal for modern farming. On Freshfields there is an old farmhouse and an Essex barn both rented out.Mr. Rowsell,the owner, lives in a house which was built about 24 years ago. There are also 2 modern bungalows which were once occupied by stockmen but are now rented out.Two C19th cottages are now derelict. This is due to the change from dairy to arable farming as well as the use of machinery. by VICTORIA BONARD t
